thread.section_title: Arts & Entertainment Top Stories on DNAINFO.com - Sunday, October 11, 2015 | 3:42am
thread.title: VIDEO: More Pizza Rats!

title: VIDEO: More Pizza Rats!
text:
Reddit/Bebedvd 
It's a tail of two pizza rats . 
New York's recent favorite animal has some competition with pictures and videos of other pizza-loving vermin being posted online Thursday — including a pair in an epic duel over a slice. A video posted by Jonathen Liu (@jonathenlewd) on Oct 8, 2015 at 5:11pm PDT 
Jonathen Liu posted a video on Instagram of two rats on subway tracks in a tug-of-war over a slice of pizza, which was first noticed by Gothamist . "I win today, interwebs," Liu boasted about his video. 
On Reddit, user Bebedvd posted an image of another rat chowing down on a slice on the tracks of the Queens-bound N, R with the caption "I spotted a celebrity in the subway in Union Square." 
They all appeared to be plain slices, just like the original pizza rat who won the hearts of New Yorkers last month when a video was posted of him trying to drag a full slice down the staircase of the L train, but giving up near the bottom. 
The comedian who captured the viral video said the rodent symbolized what many New Yorkers experience living in the big city. 
"You’re carrying too much and you have to go too far and there’s always a lot going on," Matthew Little previously told DNAinfo New York. 
"He’s not the hero that New York City needs," Little continued, "he’s the hero that New York City deserves." 
The Pizza Rat sensation spun off at least two video games , a theme song and a mention by Miley Cyrus in her opening monologue on "Saturday Night Live." 
While the desire for more Pizza Rat is obvious, it's unclear why people keep throwing perfectly good slices of pizza on subway tracks. At least the rats aren't using a fork and knife to eat them.
